excerpt: Designing a validation system that can be applied to fields based on a clients Email Design System that require their staff to make a changes to meet expectation from the Design System.
projectDetails: Creating a validation system that can be applied to fields based on a clients Email Design System that require their staff to make a changes to adhere to their required needs for email design. Clients expressed to me a great frustration when using the Taxi For Email WebApp that their staff responsible for making emails did not know which fields needed to be changed, required to be changed and appropriate character length and image to be used. I clearly identified that there is a need for the User Interface to highlight email campaign cards, different email versions and within each email version inside the Email Editor that fields needed to be highlighted that was clear to the user but not in any way intrusive which put off that overall aesthetic of the email editor had content that needed to be changed or specific types of content. I designed a unique way to display validations on fields by utilising border on the left side of the field which ensured that the validation was not intrusive but still ensured users that this is a field that had a requirement set from the Email Design System. I took this design proposal to our development team and pitched what the requirement was and the solution I proposed and asked for feedback on whether this could be implemented. All developers agreed that this functionality could be built into the Taxi Email Editor. To test this design I asked clients who initially expressed their concerns regarding fields that needed to meet the Email Design System needs and see if they could clearly see if a field does not meet the spec of their Design System and they had agreed that it really helped solved their needs.
problem: Clients struggled with unclear field validation in our email editor, leading to errors and frustration when adhering to their design systems.
solution: I designed a non-intrusive left-border validation system to highlight required field changes.
outcome: Developers approved and implemented the design, and client testing confirmed it effectively addressed their validation issues.
